DataElement.preferredName: Research Activity dbGaP Accession Number Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A stable unique alphanumeric identifier assigned to a study and any objects by the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:A stable unique alphanumeric identifier assigned to a study and any objects by the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCDI Example
ReferenceDocuments.description:
study                              phs000000.v1.p1
phenotype variables      phv000002.v1.p2
phenotype trait tables    pht000001.v1.p2
documents                     phd000003.v1.p1
genotype datasets         phg000001.v1.p1
analysis                         pha000002.v1.p2

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCDI Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Format of dbGaP accession numbers: yyy######.v#.p#.c# where:

yyy corresponds to one of the six dbGaP object types:
   study                               phs######.v#.p#
   phenotype variables       phv######.v#.p#
   phenotype trait tables     pht######.v#.p#
   documents                      phd######.v#.p#
   genotype datasets          phg######.v#.p#
   analysis                          pha######.v#.p#

Suffix v# corresponds to the data version.
Suffix p# corresponds to the participant set version.
Suffix c# corresponds to the consent group version.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRDC Coding Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Format of a dbGaP study accession number: phs######.v#.p#
